alert.note: Alert for Colorado (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 29 at 11:26PM CST until December 30 at 1:00AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Austin, Colorado, Waller and Washington. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas will be slow to recede. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1124 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing. Between 2 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bellville and Cat Spring. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
